intro: Lithocarpus mindanaensis, commonly known as the Mindanao stone栎, is a member of the Fagaceae family, native to the Philippines. It is a deciduous tree that can grow up to 20 meters tall, characterized by its thick, leathery leaves and persistent fruits. The plant produces hard, woody nuts enclosed in a cupule, which are typically used in traditional medicine. Its ecological role is significant in the tropical rainforests of Mindanao, where it contributes to soil stabilization and provides habitat for various species.
